captions.text: I'm in Love / Lee Seung ChulSBS Drama "You're All Surrounded" OST
Time's so fast, I wonder if you remember me
The painful memory in my head fades away
But how strange, it hurts right here
Tears can't wipe out that day
I can't get rid of that painful memory
But I still try to hang on to you
I must be still in love
the more I can't get rid of that painful memory
But I still try to hang on to you
I must be still in love
I run out asking if it's you
The scent you left behind on this street
But I still try to hang on to you
I don't know, I must still...
But I still try to hang on to you
I must be still in love
I'm in Love / Lee Seung ChulSBS Drama "You're All Surrounded" OST

title: [MV] Lee Seung Chul(이승철) _ I'm in love(사랑하나 봐) (You're All Surrounded(너희들은 포위됐다) OST Part.3)

comments.text:
Actually I've just recently watched this drama and come across to this 
song. Everybody has been saying that Junsu's original song is better than 
this one, but as for me, I prefer this version. It gives me a refreshing 
feeling every time I listen to it. Moreover, if it weren't for its 
appearance in the drama, I would never know the existence of the song. 
Therefore, I don't think that Lee Seung Chul should be the one to blame. He 
is a singer and this is just a song, that's all.﻿

comments.text:
the 2 couples were really cute in this series with all that drama, although 
i would have wanted a bit more of romance..one thing that seemed strange is 
how police officers were treated worse than thugs..i know they get shit 
salaries everywhere, but they're still men of the law..how can they be 
treated like that? and the way the superiors assaulted them with no 
consequence or the rich beat the poor like it's a walk in the park seemed 
freaking insane..i just hope this doesn't reflect the reality in Korea..the 
flippant way violence is dealt with in a lot of dramas worries me sometimes﻿

comments.text:
No hay duda de que ésta cancion fue cantada inicialmente por Kim Junsu, el 
decir qué version les gusta más es subjetivo y personal que no llegaríamos 
a ningun lado discutiéndolo, sólo quiero expresar mi fastidio ante la falta 
de reconocimiento al cantante original, generan muchas dudas con esto, 
incluso el cantante de esta versión ayudó a embarrarla con sus comentarios, 
me encanta mucho el drama y me apena haber leido tantos comentarios 
diversos originados por este malentendido. No sé como será la situacion en 
Corea pero no pueden negar que internacionalmente reconocemos esa cancion 
por Junsu y al no escuchar su voz recién tomamos interés por el cantante de 
este OST, por lo que reitero nada les cuesta dar a conocer también la 
version de Junsu.﻿

comments.author: tiffany tan

comments.text:
To all lee seung chul's fans you have the right to know why Xia Junsu's 
fans are angry because of LSC,  Lee Seung Chul received approval from the 
original composer, Jun Hae Sung, and original singer, Kim Junsu for "I'm in 
love", which resolved the situation of this song. However, the resolution 
was temporary. On June 4, Lee Seung Chul posted a comment on his fan café 
which stirred up fans of JYJ again. He said, “With remakes, it’s customary 
not to mention the original singer. Moreover, making Junsu’s ‘I’m in Love’ 
number one and making it known to everyone is a much better way to go about 
things, but asking a 50-year-old singer who’s been in the business for 30 
years for a public apology without any sort of consideration or respect, 
it’s a little upsetting.”
JYJ fans replied, “Then you should earn your respect as a senior,” and that 
“Things have come this far because you disregard the opinions of the fans 
and think that whatever you say is right.”
On June 16, Lee Seung Chul posted on his Twitter, “It was something I said 
with a smile, but I don’t understand what all the fuss is for. You’re 
making it hard for me to ever see Junsu again. It’s a shame,”
This is a comment that I took from soompi.com from one of lsc's fans:
"They need to give credit where it's due. Releasing it as a 'new release' 
is a slap in the face, making it look like Junsu never sang this song. I 
love Lee Seungchul as a singer, but he shouldn't get angry at Junsu's fans 
for this. He should of had just apologized to the fans because the company 
he is working for messed up. I understand he's a senior in the business, 
but not giving credit to the original singer is not an example he should 
set. What if other singers asked to sing his old famous songs and released 
it as a 'new release'? Would he like that?"

So as an international cassie I will say my opinion I will not truly know 
about KPOP if not because of DBSK and will not falling in love with kpop if 
not because of XIA JUNSU's great vocal that I hardly found around the world 
on male singers, who is lee seung chul? i don't know him at 1st but because 
of this song I got to know him.
Isn't LSC supposed to be thankful for Xia Junsu because people worldwide 
know him because "I'm in love" is known internationally? 
You think the answer by yourself.﻿
